alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 5:23AM CST until February 04 at 11:12AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Near Folsom affecting St. Tammany Parish. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tchefuncte River Near Folsom. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Areas of Spring Park and Albert Thompson Road will be inundated. Homes will flood if the river rises higher. Evacuation of those areas is recommended. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet later this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 01/01/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
